results.title: Tops
results.brief_description: Tops are among man’s oldest and most popular toys. This non-narrated film features 123 spinning tops from different lands. The essence of tops is captured as the stages of their movement are displayed. The second in the unfinished trilogy of toy films (ships would have been next). Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: Topology
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Harold Whitaker
results.brief_description:
An animated film which illustrates those properties of geometric figures or solid bodies which remain invariant under certain transformations.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Topaze
results.brief_description:
Topaze, a shy and idealistic provincial schoolteacher is used as a front by a disreputable financier to sign cheques and take the rap if necessary. But he catches on fast, and ends up by appropriating both his boss’s organization and his mistress. The combination of Jouvet’s magisterial performance and the pungent dialogue of the play that made Pagnol famous is irresistible. Pagnol himself would direct it, with Armoudy in 1936 and Fernandel in 1951 in the title role, and in 1961, Peter Sellers, directed himself disastrously in ‘Mr Topaz’. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Louis Gasnier ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Fred Langenfeld.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Paulet, Edwige Feuillere.

results.title: Top spin and back spin strokes
results.creator_credit: Richard Hackett, Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Table tennis”
Part 2 of a series of four films which show that table tennis is a very competitive sport played throughout the world by people of all ages. The game is built around attacking and defensive strokes. Some of these strokes are demonstrated like: topspin; forehand drive; backhand drive; backspin, forehand chop and backhand chop.

results.title: Top of the world: taiga, tundra, ice-cap
results.brief_description: Shows the geographical characteristics and types of natural life to be found in the world’s three northern-most regions: Canada, Siberia and Alaska. Outlines the consequences of exploiting the areas resources.
